Where to Eat Vegetarian and Vegan Food in Boston All Jan 18, 2017, 11:34am EST Whole Heart Provisions Katie Chudy for Eater 
Greater Boston does not scorn the meat-free. The metro area has a whole host of restaurants dedicated to vegetarians and vegans; plus, many restaurants that do serve meat are also well-stocked with veg-friendly options to satisfy the appetites of any group. Peruse this map to dine meat-free in Allston, East Boston, Newton, Somerville, Chinatown, and beyond. 
In addition to the excellent home-grown spots mapped here, there are a handful of veg-friendly chains worth checking out, such as DC-based Sweetgreen and New York's Dig Inn, which have recently opened Boston-area locations and will continue to expand throughout the region in the coming months. Additionally, By Chloe, a fully vegan restaurant originally based in New York City, will be opening an outpost in Boston's Seaport , followed by one in Fenway. 
If we missed your favorite spot or if you know of other great vegetarian and vegan dining options in the area, let us know in the comments below or . Also, keep an eye on any news pertaining to Boston-area vegan, vegetarian, and veg-friendly restaurants right here . 
Note: Map points are arranged alphabetically, not ranked. 
Originally published on November 1, 2016. This map is updated periodically; the date of the most recent update appears above. 1 Amsterdam Falafelshop 
Whether in a sandwich, in a bowl, or on a platter, the falafel at Amsterdam Falafelshop is vegetarian-friendly. Choose from a host of additional toppings, including tabbouleh, tomatoes, cucumbers, and some rotating seasonal options. Rachel Leah Blumenthal for Eater 642 Beacon St
